crew_ability_take_the_shot_description: When any PC takes the decisive action to eliminate a key target, they get +1d (this counts as a Devil’s Bargain).
crew_ability_under_the_radar_description: When you kill someone during a score you can take 2 stress so that it doesn’t count towards heat afterwards. How does your crew avoid the death radar?
crew_ability_chameleons_description: When your opening gambit involves stealth or subterfuge, take +1d to the engagement roll. When you subdue someone and don their outfit, the disguise has increased effect.
crew_ability_cold_storage_description: Take 1 stress at any time to find a convenient place to hide a body, near to hand.
crew_ability_benefactor_description: When you take this ability, the crew immediately receives 4 stacks. Whenever you advance your Tier, it costs half the stacks it normally would. Who’s backing you? Why do they help you?
crew_ability_loopers_description: Whether intentionally or not, your crew is caught in an anomaly and repeats every day twice. Usually you don’t retain memory between loops, but each PC in the crew may jump loops once per day. Take 4 stress after any action roll to roll it again, and take the best result between the two rolls. The second roll uses the exact same number of dice (pushes, assists, etc). You can choose to do this after the GM has announced the consequences, but not after any resistance rolls.
crew_ability_professionals_description: When you keep an operation quiet or make it look like an accident, you get half the rep value of the target (round up) instead of zero. When you end downtime with zero heat, take +1 rep.
crew_ability_sympathizers_description: The common citizenry of your home ground, and any turf you hold, are sympathetic to you and your cause. You can consider them allies (status +3). When asked they will: give you shelter or a place to hide, redirect bluecoats or other enemies, or give you other aid if they can.
crew_ability_mutual_aid_description: You can lend support to one allied faction, and their Tier counts as one higher as long as you do. Your crew gets one free downtime action to work one of that faction’s longterm project clocks, if you wish. You can switch support once per downtime.
crew_ability_guerrillas_description: When the target of a score is two or more Tier higher than you, take +1d to the engagement roll, and gain +2 rep after the score (whether you were successful or not).
crew_ability_on_the_side_of_the_oppresse: On the Side of the Oppressed
You loudly and openly oppose the Bluecoats and their authoritarianism. You may count each wanted level as if it was turf.
crew_ability_absolute_commitment_descrip: You have all sworn solemn vows of service to the cause. You get +1d to resistance rolls.
crew_ability_revolutionaries_description: When you’re at war (-3 faction status), your crew does not suffer -1 hold and PCs still get two downtime activities, instead of just one.
crew_ability_putting_the_band_back_toget: When any PC deadlocks, they drop out of the score entirely. Introduce a new character who makes an entrance at any time of your choosing. The character starts with bonus action dots, playbook abilities, full rows of bank, and deadlocks equal to the crew Tier (up to a max of 3).
crew_ability_one_last_job_description: Before a job, any player may declare that this will be their character’s last score. When this is declared, the character clears all stress and gets 3 free downtime actions to use immediately or during flashbacks. Add +1d to the engagement roll. That PC must retire after the score.
crew_ability_pulled_back_in_description: You can bring a retired PC backwith a 10-step long term project clock (distribute 2 free ticks amongst any such clocks during each downtime). A returning character clears all harm and stress, and 1 deadlock becomes a key again.
crew_ability_thieves_with_a_code_descrip: When you complete a score with no deaths having occurred, gain +1 faction status with the local citizenry.
crew_ability_sleepy_time_description: Everyone on the crew adds tranquilizer rounds (0 load, compatible with any firearm) to their playbook items.
crew_ability_what_could_possibly_go_wron: Your crew has shadow twins in the Resonance Field. You may call your doppelgänger into this reality to complete an action for you; they do it with increased effect and no need to roll—treat the result as a crit. Your shadow twin remains in the world and is controlled by the GM from this point forward.
crew_ability_enlightened_description: You get +1d to resistance rolls against paranormal threats and consequences. You get +1d to healing rolls when you have paranormal harm.
crew_ability_commune_description: You may use teamwork with any crew member, regardless of the distance separating you. By taking 1 stress, your projected thoughts are heard by every crew member as telepathic communication.
crew_ability_synchronized_watches_descri: You may use assists or setup actions with any crew member, regardless of the distance separating you. When you perform a group action, you may count multiple 6s from different rolls as a critical success.
crew_ability_second_circle_description: ONCE YOU HAVE DESCENDED TO THE SECOND CIRCLE, YOU MAY CHOOSE THESE:
crew_ability_true_believers_description: Your cohorts will undertake any service, no matter how dangerous or strange. They gain +1d to rolls against enemies of the utopian vision.
crew_ability_altered_states_description: Each PC gains an additional Vice: Ritual Hedonism. When you indulge this vice, you don't overindulge if you clear excess stress. In addition, your ecstatic visions of the future mean you can perform one flashback for free.
crew_ability_third_circle_description: ONCE YOU HAVE DESCENDED TO THE THIRD CIRCLE, YOU MAY CHOOSE THESE:
crew_ability_for_the_greater_good_descri: Each human sacrifice yields -3 stress cost for any ritual or paranormal experiment you perform.
crew_ability_this_is_fine_description: If every PC works together (group action), you can summon a denizen of your utopian vision into this reality; a Class V Resonance Entity (”horror”).
crew_ability_fourth_circle_description: ONCE YOU HAVE DESCENDED TO THE FINAL CIRCLE, YOU MAY CHOOSE THESE:
crew_ability_remember_the_forgotten_desc: You can now communicate with the entity that controls your utopian vision (a “god”?). Tread carefully.
crew_ability_we_no_longer_play_by_your_r: We No Longer Play By Your Rules
When you take this advance, immediately pick two more advances. Cannot be taken as a Versatile advance.
truths1: Choose 2 truths of the Vision: Free / Egalitarian / Abundant / Beautiful / Serene / Radiant / Natural
truths2: Learn a new truth of the Vision: Shifting / Sweltering / Lustful / Unsettling / Future / Past / Alien
truths3: Learn a new truth of the Vision: Psychedelic / Inhuman / Violent / Future / Past / Tempestuous
truths4: Learn a new truth of the Vision: Fiery / Frozen / Terrifying / Cruel / Monstrous / Capricious / Inhuman
threshold1: Threshold of Gold: Circle unlocks when the crew has earned 20 stacks total
threshold2: Threshold of Blood: Circle unlocks when the crew has also ended at least 10 lives
threshold3: Threshold of Power: Circle unlocks when the crew has also reached Tier 3
crew_ability_first_ones_free_description: You can give away your product to build rep during downtime. 1 rep costs 2 units.
crew_ability_like_candy_description: Your merchandise is exquisite. Gain potency when you Sway or Consort with those hooked on your product. When you deal with a crew or faction, the GM will tell you who among them is hooked (one, a few, many, or all).
crew_ability_on_retainer_description: You have an expert lawyer representing your crew. Their quality is equal to crew tier + 3. When you take the Reduce Heat downtime action, you can have your lawyer roll their quality instead. When you take the rap, your wanted level counts as one lower for the purposes of sentencing.
crew_ability_cat_and_mouse_description: The GM will tell you about any special mandates investigating your outfit, and put their clocks on the table from now on. You get +2d to the engagement roll when they do make a move against you.
crew_ability_double_blind_description: Your crew has shadow twins in the Resonance Field. Each PC can call their doppelgänger into this reality to complete an action for them; the twin does it with increased effect and no need to roll — treat the result as a crit.
crew_ability_bleeding_edge_description: You have an experimental new product that pays out twice the stacks but generates twice the heat during supply and distribution. Track these units separately.
crew_ability_payment_in_kind_description: You can use units to purchase crew upgrades. 1 crew upgrade costs 4 units (so a new cohort would cost 8 units).
product_qualities: Enlightening / Dangerous—Upper / Downer / Psychedelic / Sophisticated / Unusual
crew_ability_custom_ride_description: Create one of your vehicles (autopod, autocycle, boat, etc) as a cohort (use 1-2 vehicle edges, and equal number of flaws). Its quality is equal to your Tier +1.
crew_ability_stunt_riders_description: The first time one of the crew’s signature stunts is performed during a score, take +2d and increased effect. Choose one to start with. The crew masters an additional signature stunt each time you take this ability. You can do any of  these these stunts even if they’re not a signature, but don’t get bonus dice etc.
crew_ability_escape_velocity_description: One of the crew’s vehicles is fitted with a device that activates at a specific speed. This requires filling an 8-segment acceleration clock during the score . When the clock is filled and the vehicle hits the target speed, choose an effect: break the laws of gravity—create a tear in reality—travel into the Resonance Field— travel backwards or forwards through time.
crew_ability_the_family_takes_a_cut_desc: Before payoff for a smuggling or hijacking score, the crew can skim the goods for +2 stacks. The GM will tick a clock.
crew_ability_bring_them_in_description: As long as you’re not currently fighting them (e.g. you’re at war), you can turn even the most bitter of enemies into family. This requires a long term project — 6-segment to turn them into a crew contact, 10-segment to turn them into a cohort or PC (your choice). If they become a PC, create them as normal, with bonus action dots and abilities each equal to their Tier, and any deadlocks at the GM’s discretion. Their faction’s relationship to your crew does not change.
crew_ability_speed_demons_description: When you go into conflict aboard a vehicle, you gain increased effect for vehicle damage and speed. Your vehicle gains armor.
smugglers_turn: Smuggler’s Turn: A controlled skid and turn before speeding off in the opposite direction.
reverse180: Reverse 180: Spinning 180 degrees and continuing in the same direction but facing backwards.
shell_game: Shell Game: Launching decoy vehicles (may need to acquire an assset) to confuse and surprise.
outside_ride: Outside Ride: Riding the roof, side, or hood of a moving vehicle, and leaping from vehicle to vehicle.
big_air: Big Air: Launching a vehicle into the air across a surprising distance with any improvised ramp.
ramming_speed: Ramming Speed: Putting your foot down and meeting obstacles head-on.
vehicle_edges:
Nimble: The vehicle handles easily. Consider this an assist for tricky maneuvers.

Simple: The vehicle is easy to repair. Remove all of its harm during downtime.

Sturdy: The vehicle keeps operating even when broken.
vehicle_flaws:
Guzzler: The vehicle costs 1 stack per downtime to keep in operation.

Distinct: The vehicle has memorable features. Take +1 heat when you use it on a score.

Finicky: When operated without the one person who truly understands its quirks, the vehicle has -1 quality.
backing_faction_help_blurb: Each type of help can be called on once per gameplay cycle (crew business then personal business). Check it off when you use it. At the end of the gameplay cycle, make a fortune roll to see if they ask for a favor in return.
backinghelp_1: Assist on your action roll, as if they were a teammate (+1d).
backinghelp_2: Increase effect on your action roll, as though you pushed yourself
backinghelp_3: Resist or dismiss unwanted consequences, if it’s within their powers.
backinghelp_4: Loan you equipment of their tier level in quality.
backinghelp_4b: Increase result level on a downtime activity roll.
backinghelp_5: Share relevant intel with you; make a gather information fortune roll with dice equal to their tier.
backinghelp_6: Give you a 1 stack reward when handing over information of interest to them.
backinghelp_7: Intervene with another faction on your behalf, if it’s within their powers.
